void iField_initEntArrIter (const iField_Instance instance, const iField_DomainHandle domain_handle, const int requested_entity_type, const int requested_entity_topology, const int requested_array_size, const int resilient, iBase_EntityArrIterator *entArr_iterator, int *err)

Function Documentation

void iField_initEntArrIter ( const iField_Instance  instance,
const iField_DomainHandle  domain_handle,
const int  requested_entity_type,
const int  requested_entity_topology,
const int  requested_array_size,
const int  resilient,
iBase_EntityArrIterator *  entArr_iterator,
int *  err 
)

Initialize an array iterator over specified entity type, topology, and size.

Initialize an array iterator over specified entity type, topology, and size, for a specified domain. Iterator returned can be used as input to functions returning entities for the iterator. If all entities of a specified type and/or topology are to be iterated, specify iBase_ALL_TYPES or iMesh_ALL_TOPOLOGIES, respectively. Specified type or topology must be a value in the iBase_EntityType or iMesh_EntityTopology enumerations, respectively. Note that we will probably want (certainly need?) different syntax for iterators over geometric domains.

Parameters:
[in] instance iField instance handle
[in] domain_handle Domain to iterate over
[in] requested_entity_type Type of entity to iterate
[in] requested_entity_topology Topology of entity to iterate
[in] requested_array_size Size of blocks for iterator to return.
[in] resilient If zero, return a non-resilient iterator. Otherise, a resilient iterator (Resilient and Non-Resilient Iterators)
[out] entArr_iterator New iterator returned by function
[out] err Returned Error status (see iBase_ErrorType)

const iField_DomainHandle  domain_handle,

Initialize an iterator over specified entity type and topology.

Initialize an array iterator over specified entity type and topology. Iterator returned can be used as input to functions returning entities for the iterator. If all entities of a specified type and/or topology are to be iterated, specify iBase_ALL_TYPES or iMesh_ALL_TOPOLOGIES, respectively. Specified type or topology must be a value in the iBase_EntityType or iMesh_EntityTopology enumerations, respectively. Note that we will probably want (certainly need?) different syntax for iterators over geometric domains.

[in] requested_entity_type Type of entity to iterate
[in] requested_entity_topology Topology of entity to iterate
[in] resilient If zero, return a non-resilient iterator. Otherise, a resilient iterator (Resilient and Non-Resilient Iterators)
[out] entity_iterator New iterator returned by function
[out] err Returned Error status (see iBase_ErrorType)
